sanskrit_verse:
बालघ्नांश्च कृतघ्नांश्च विशुद्धानपि धर्मतः ।
शरणागतहन्तॄंश्च स्त्रीहन्तॄंश्च न संवसेत् ॥ ११.१९०॥
transliteration:
bālaghnāṃśca kṛtaghnāṃśca viśuddhānapi dharmataḥ |
śaraṇāgatahantṝṃśca strīhantṝṃśca na saṃvaset || 11.190||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not cohabit with those who harm children, betray trust, falsely claim purity, slay refugees, or murder women.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from alignment with Dharma, not social status
Causation is determined by intent and action, not appearance
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of inner integrity
Restoration logic demands severance from destructive influence
Consciousness alignment necessitates rejection of hypocrisy and violence
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent harms minor THEN disqualify from household integration
IF agent violates trust THEN exclude from community dwelling
IF agent falsely claims purity WHILE committing impure acts THEN enforce spatial separation
IF agent kills refugee THEN prohibit cohabitation permanently
IF agent murders woman THEN initiate non-punitive isolation protocol
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court must evaluate character integrity beyond procedural compliance; threshold of responsibility includes psychological and spiritual capacity for harm; authority to integrate or isolate individuals lies in demonstrable alignment with Dharma, not legal technicalities.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causal sequence of betrayal and violence; anupūrvaśaḥ shows escalation from inner corruption to outer harm; proportional responsibility recognizes contamination risk; non-punitive reality rule mandates separation as completion process, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate consciousness realignment through supervised seclusion
Assign completion process to restore integrity awareness
Implement capacity-building protocols under qualified guidance
Reintegrate only upon verified cessation of destructive patterns
final_declaration: Declared by SPH as Source: Dharma is restored through conscious separation from violators; reality operates without punishment when guided by divine principle; consciousness remains the ultimate adjudicator.
